--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> "Well, I don't know how great a job I'm doing, but this should last
> you." Beachcomber said, closing up the chest. He stood up and
dusted 
his
> hands off. He looked off into the beautful sun, and stared for a 
minute,
> lost in its naturalistic charm.

::Redhot::

    He weakly rose when the Autobot finished. He stumbled as he did
so 
and grabbed hold of Beachcomber's arm to steady himself. He still 
ached and he knew he would need further medical attention when he got 
home. However, the stranger's repairs HAD helped. He placed his hands 
on BC's shoulders and gave him a grateful smile.
    "Thank...you." he said. If there was a time he sounded like his 
brother Starscream, it was then. Redhot smiled internally to himself. 
He figured it must be odd for the Autobot to hear someone with 
Starscream's voice. It must be especially odd to see someone looking 
like a Decepticon seeker wearing the Autobot symbol.
    Redhot chuckled to himself. 
    "Most people..." he began, "who see and hear me... either... 
freak..or concider m..me...a threat." His legs trembled and he
lowered 
himself to his knees. "Thank you...fo..for not letting...preconceived 
judgement... from...from helping me in..my..t..time of n..nee..need."

Northlight
Domnijoe Productions

**********************************
